title: [K-12] Macao Tourism Retail and Marketing Management Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic marketing theory and retail operations processes
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education based on experiential learning theory and Bloom’s taxonomy, conducted in a microlearning environment utilizing digital devices, with competency achievement measured through summative assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can simulate three customer scenarios (e.g., complaints, product inquiries, purchase recommendations) within one week, identify ≥2 needs per scenario, and propose ≥1 sales strategy meeting checklist criteria (clarity, feasibility, customer customization).

Learners can analyze virtual target customers (by age group, interests) using digital marketing tools (Google Analytics, Canva) and complete three types of customized promotion plans (including images/text) within one week.

In team-based role-playing activities (4-person teams), learners perform three cross-cultural communication scenarios in global retail settings (e.g., airport duty-free shops, hotel shops), write dialogues reflecting ≥5 culture-specific etiquettes (greetings, gift-giving), and provide peer feedback meeting ≥3 of 4 checklist items.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
